thread.title: We’re not surprised these $4 minimalist mugs keep selling out
thread.title_full: We’re not surprised these $4 minimalist mugs keep selling out

author: Gabriela Herstik
title: We’re not surprised these $4 minimalist mugs keep selling out
text:
We’re not surprised these $4 minimalist mugs keep selling out Trends come and go, but coffee is forever. But for many of us, our morning cup of coffee, while serving us some serious caffeine and all over goodness, also acts as the ample time to Instagram our morning ritual. After all, do you really have cute mugs if everyone on the internet doesn’t know about them? That’s why these minimalist Rae Dunn mugs are selling out, and selling out fast. In fact, they’re pretty much the Instagram celebrities of the coffee world. The mugs are simple, with glossy white bodies and one or two words etched in, in a elongated fine print. Some popular sayings on the mugs include “coffee,” “create,” “friend,” and the ever popular “hey girl.”
hello crazy friend . . . let's eat ! i've always been one for word games. (via @tinavandeusen) 
A post shared by Rae Dunn (@raedunnclay) on Mar 16, 2017 at 7:45am PDT 
well HELLO weekend . . . i've been waiting for you ! ( via @lizajanephotography) 
A post shared by Rae Dunn (@raedunnclay) on Mar 11, 2017 at 6:09am PST 
girl gone WILD. (via @florally_gr8ful) 
A post shared by Rae Dunn (@raedunnclay) on Feb 26, 2017 at 9:32am PST 
But as per usual, the internet took a fancy to these minimal mugs and now they’re not as easy to find. The $4 mugs are sold at HomeGoods, Marshall’s and TJ Maxx but now even these stores have trouble keeping these cups on the shelf. Rae Dunn, who started her namesake line, is a California-based artist whose worked with clay for over 20 years. Her creations now have a market on the internet, where eBay, Amazon and Etsy all sell Dunn’s Instagram ready creations (but with a markup on price!).
These mugs may seem like any other mug, and they pretty much are, but they’re also much more Instagram ready. Are these clay pieces the secret to Instagram success? Perhaps! And if you don’t feel like paying extra money, head to your local Marshalls or HomeGoods on Tuesday or Wednesday morning. According to blog The Glam Farmhouse , these stores get shipments of clay wear in on these days. Just make sure you go as early as you can so these pieces don’t sell out!
